Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Adjust text on details field in Report Package form." (#8882) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Add this text after the request for details sentence for safety violations: ‚ÄúPlease also describe where in the package the problem was found.‚Äù

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Additional online safety instructions in report package page" (#8902) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8899

This change instructs the reporter of abuse to include specifics that will help us address the problem quickly. The other accommodations for online safety reporting (no contact checkbox, additional detail for imminent harm reporting, revenge porn portal directions) are all preserved.

![kBIKcd1FzY](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/144378864-5f4ee6cb-9eb1-4010-96f6-897488b74cf5.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Re-add a11y to checkmarks and bangs in package details page" (#8901) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8897

Adds the popovers into the new v2 package details page for reserved checkmarks (including alt tag) and vulnerable/deprecated bangs. Narrator support also restored, and there needed to be tab stops added to ID and version.

This video cuts out at the reserved checkmark but you get the idea from the bangs demo (I pause and point at the changes):
![rsUt0o3FSu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/144371751-31af68b5-3076-4117-8a9a-489c7c14310c.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Some packets are pushed slowly to nuget.server" (#8900) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe

### Product Version

nuget.exe 5.11.0.10, msbuild  16.11.1.47101, nuget.server 3.4.1.0

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. step one: create some nupkg packages using msbuild xml.  The following code is used to build the package

`<MSBuild Projects="$(BuildSolutionDir)/Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client/Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client.csproj" Targets="Restore" />
<MSBuild Projects="$(BuildSolutionDir)/Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client/Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client.csproj"
				 Targets="Build;Pack"	Properties="Configuration=$(Configuration);PackageOutputPath=$(NuGetPackageDir);Authors=$(Authors);Version=$(Version)" />`


2. step two: push packages with a powershell script to nuget server (hosted in iis 10).  some package need 250ms to be pushed, other need more than 30sec.  The following is the code I use to push the package

`$PackagePath = "$(Get-Location)\Packages"
Get-ChildItem $PackagePath -Filter *.nupkg|
Foreach-Object {
    Invoke-Expression "$($NugetPath) push $($_.FullName) -Source $($NugetApi) -ApiKey $($NugetApiKey) -Verbosity detailed" 
    Remove-Item $_.FullName
}`

The strange behaviour occur when publishing new packets and when replacing existing packets.  It looks like nuget server rebuild some cache


### Verbose Logs

```shell
NuGet Version: 5.11.0.10
Pushing Mares.Scheduler.Api.Client.3.0.2.nupkg to 'http://192.168.34.200:81/api/v2/package'...
  PUT http://192.168.34.200:81/api/v2/package/
  Created http://192.168.34.200:81/api/v2/package/ 45121ms
Your package was pushed.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add additional text to use of online safety categories in report package form" (#8899) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Add this text above the details box when a safety category is chosen:

Please also describe where in the package the problem was found. 

Be sure to include:
-	Whether the problem is in graphics, video, readme, scripts, libraries, nuspec, other metadata, other file(s).
-	The exact names of the offending file(s).


/cc @jcjiang

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Add open.vscode.dev to allowed domains for images and badges" (#8898) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

The open.vscode.dev domain is not included in the list of [allowed domains for images and badges](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/nuget-org/package-readme-on-nuget-org#allowed-domains-for-images-and-badges) for package readme files. This breaks loading "_Open in Visual Studio Code_" badges, with only the alt text being displayed. It's a minor cosmetic issue, but if there's no security concerns it would be nice to have the domain added to the allow list. It is a Microsoft owned domain.

### Repro Steps

Upload any package with an included readme and an _Open in Visual Studio Code_ badge referencing the open.vscode.dev domain.

### Expected Behavior

Loads the _Open in Visual Studio Code_ badge.

### Screenshots

Current:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3214803/144153559-ee29caaf-d01c-4483-8a20-05b820db1173.png)

Desired:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3214803/144153625-4e6173ca-5d65-4aaa-9cba-931ff24f8fd2.png)


### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature]:  Syntax Highlighting for code example in Readme.md" (#8894) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

The code examples on .nuget have no syntax highlighting. In some case this might be confusing for users.


### The Elevator Pitch

Add Syntax Highlighting for code examples at readme.md. (Like the one here on github)

### Additional Context and Details

Example:

 C# Code:
```C#
public class Foo {
  public string GetBar() => "bar";
}

```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Non-Sdk solution not restoring all nuget packages on VS 2019 IDE" (#10261) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.7.0.6726

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate): 16.8.1

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Microsoft Windows [Version 10.0.19041.572]

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

Recently, we migrated our solution  from packages.config to packagerefences, after that, we can't get a successful build using only VS IDE 2019, because of the missing NuGet packages, on the logs we discover that only 21 projects from a total of 55 are restored.

1. Clone the repository https://github.com/DynamoDS/Dynamo using packagerefence branch

2. Open src/Dynamo.All.sln on VS 2019 IDE

3. Build solution (Debug|Release/AnyCPU) **or** 

3. Restore NuGet packages

4. Build Solution 

...

## Other suggested things

In order to get a successful build of the solution, we need to do this steps :

With VS 2019 IDE

1. Clone the repository https://github.com/DynamoDS/Dynamo using packagerefence branch

2. Open a Dev Command Prompt for VS 2019 and execute: nuget.exe restore src/Dynamo.All.sln

3. Open src/Dynamo.All.sln on VS 2019 IDE

4. Build solution (Debug|Release/AnyCPU)

Command Line

1. Clone the repository https://github.com/DynamoDS/Dynamo  using packagerefence branch

2. Open a Dev Command Prompt for VS 2019 and execute this commands: 

```
nuget.exe restore src/Dynamo.All.sln

msbuild /t:restore src/Dynamo.All.sln

msbuild src/Dynamo.All.sln
```


### Verbose Logs

[VSIDERestore.log](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5533392/VSIDERestore.log)

### Sample Project

https://github.com/DynamoDS/Dynamo/tree/packagerefence

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Restoring with invalid target framework says 'unsupported' instead of showing bad framework name" (#5413) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Given `<TargetFramework>abc123</TargetFramework>`, RestoreTask yields:
```
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\Preview\Enterprise\Common7\IDE\CommonExtensions\Microsoft\NuGet\NuGet.targets(102,5): 
error : Invalid restore input. Invalid target framework 'unsupported'. Input files: D:\Temp\qwerty\qwerty.csproj. [D:\Temp\qwerty\qwerty.csproj]
```

It should indicate the badly spelled framework  'abc13' in the error message instead of 'unsupported'.

We tried to fix this by running our own check before restore in the SDK, but that breaks adding support for additional TFMs like uap using the MSBuild.Sdk.Extras package.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Restoring with invalid target framework says 'unsupported' instead of showing bad framework name" (#5413) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Given `<TargetFramework>abc123</TargetFramework>`, RestoreTask yields:
```
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\Preview\Enterprise\Common7\IDE\CommonExtensions\Microsoft\NuGet\NuGet.targets(102,5): 
error : Invalid restore input. Invalid target framework 'unsupported'. Input files: D:\Temp\qwerty\qwerty.csproj. [D:\Temp\qwerty\qwerty.csproj]
```

It should indicate the badly spelled framework  'abc13' in the error message instead of 'unsupported'.

We tried to fix this by running our own check before restore in the SDK, but that breaks adding support for additional TFMs like uap using the MSBuild.Sdk.Extras package.
Adding detailed design notes for transitive dependencies

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: After adding key via `nuget setApiKey`, push commands error with `Key not valid for use in specified state.` & exit with code 1" (#11428) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

5.11.0.10

### Worked before?

Worked before a machine reload, so I have to assume the problem is more with setApiKey than with push perhaps?

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. generate an api key at nuget.org
2. `nuget setApiKey {key} -source nuget.org`
3. `nuget.exe push {package} -NonInteractive -Source nuget.org -Timeout 300 -SkipDuplicate`
4. process exits with code 1 and an error about the key state

### Verbose Logs

```shell
‚ûú nuget.exe push .\.release-packages\PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg -NonInteractive -SOurce nuget.org -Timeout 300 -SkipDuplicate -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.4.0.6315
Pushing PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg to 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package'...
  PUT https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/
  Conflict https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package/ 7430ms
Package 'C:\code\opensource\PeanutButter\.\.release-packages\PeanutButter.XmlUtils.2.0.50.nupkg' already exists at feed 'https://www.nuget.org/api/v2/package'.
Key not valid for use in specified state.
System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException: Key not valid for use in specified state.

   at System.Security.Cryptography.ProtectedData.Unprotect(Byte[] encryptedData, Byte[] optionalEntropy, DataProtectionScope scope)
   at NuGet.Configuration.EncryptionUtility.DecryptString(String encryptedString)
   at NuGet.Configuration.SettingsUtility.GetDecryptedValueForAddItem(ISettings settings, String section, String key, Boolean isPath)
   at NuGet.Commands.CommandRunnerUtility.GetApiKey(ISettings settings, String endpoint, String source, String defaultApiKey, Boolean isSymbolApiKey)
   at NuGet.Commands.PushRunner.<>c__DisplayClass0_0.<Run>b__1(String symbolsEndpoint)
   at NuGet.Protocol.Core.Types.PackageUpdateResource.<Push>d__14.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.Commands.PushRunner.<Run>d__0.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.PushCommand.<ExecuteCommandAsync>d__36.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Command.Execute()
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add support for requesting nomination data for projects" (#6575) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
GetPackageSpec should block and request nomination info from the project system when there is no data present. The current behavior is to return null which ultimately causes a failed restore when project details are missing.

This requires a way to query the project system for that information instead of just waiting until it is pushed to the nomination API.

### Expected flow
Test explorer **->** NuGet **->** Project system

A request for installed packages requires the list of PackageReference entries. When the call is received NuGet should block and request the information from the project system in order to get the information.

### Actual flow
Test explorer **->** NuGet **<-** Project system

Since both arrows are incoming for NuGet, it can't block. Instead it just gives up immediately when it doesn't have the data. Other times NuGet returns out of date information.

### Examples
* Test explorer often fails to determine if a project has xunit installed because NuGet throws an exception until the project system pushes the needed info.
* Auto restore fails with an error related to missing project details. NuGet is unable to determine if all nomination info has been sent.
* Back to back package operations fail. For example: install, then uninstall. Uninstall does not see the latest project info because the project system is still processing it and will fail saying that the package isn't installed.

Relevant code:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/7fc2573b76fceb8a007a25012027c5b829c0801a/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio/Projects/NetCorePackageReferenceProject.cs#L110-L118
